item.title: Nintendo Sues Accessory Maker Genki Over "Glitch 2" Switch 2 Range
item.content:encoded:
https://techraptor.net/gaming/news/nintendo-genki-switch-2-lawsuit

Nintendo is suing accessory maker Genki over the latter's "Glitch 2" Switch 2 accessory range, alleging trademark infringement and false advertising under federal and California state law.

According to The Game Post, Nintendo's lawsuit, which was filed last week, claims Genki used Nintendo's "Switch" and "Joy-Con" trademarks in order to make it seem as though the accessory company's products were approved by Nintendo.

This, according to Nintendo's lawsuit, included the demonstration of what Genki claimed to be accurate Switch 2 mockups at the CES 2025 trade show, which took place prior to the console's official announcement in January.

In the lawsuit, Nintendo goes on to say that Genki's semi-April Fools' Day joke, which saw it holding a suspiciously Nintendo Direct-style showcase in which it revealed a range of accessories for the so-called "Glitch 2", was an "obvious reference" to the Switch 2.

The Japanese gaming giant says that Genki's claims of compatibility on "day one" for the Glitch 2 range was misleading and illegal, because Nintendo hadn't provided Genki with a Switch 2 prior to release.

This means the accessory maker either wasn't in "possession of a genuine console" and thus couldn't make claims of compatibility "in good faith", or said console (or information pertaining to its specs) was "unlawfully or illicitly obtained".

Nintendo also says Genki's use of its trademarks would make it likely consumers would "falsely perceive a connection, association, sponsorship, or affiliation" between the two companies where no such partnership exists.

As for what Nintendo wants from the lawsuit, it's asking the court to put a stop to Genki selling Switch 2-related accessories. In The Game Post's words, it wants Genki to "destroy any products or ads that use Nintendo trademarks", as well as handing over profits related to Switch 2 accessory sales.

If you're in the mood to peruse some legal documentation, you can check out the full lawsuit here, courtesy of The Game Post.

Joe has been writing for TechRaptor for several years, and in those years has learned a lot about the gaming industry and its foibles. He’s originally an… More about Joseph

item.title: Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 Sales Reach 3m
item.content:encoded:
https://techraptor.net/gaming/news/kingdom-come-deliverance-2-sales-3m

Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 developer and publisher Warhorse Studios has announced that its medieval open-world RPG has managed to pass a brand new sales milestone.

Speaking over the weekend, Warhorse said that Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 sales have reached a rather impressive three million in three months, thanking players for "making history" with the studio.

The figure means that sales of the game have slowed down a little since its meteoric beginnings; Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 managed to surpass a million sales in its first day on release, going on to break the two million barrier in under two weeks.

Even so, three million sales is a pretty impressive figure for what is, in the end, a fairly niche title. Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 places a heavy emphasis on realism rather than traditional RPG fantasy elements, so the fact it's managed to find an audience this wide is no mean feat.

If you're not familiar with Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2, it's the sequel to the 2018 original. Much like its predecessor, the game is a medieval RPG set in 15th-century Bohemia, and it follows the blacksmith's son Henry of Skalitz as he navigates a web of political and historical intrigue.

Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 boasts a world twice the size of the original game, and it's also got a script that runs to a formidable two million words, according to Warhorse Studios.

Naturally, you'll also find new skills and systems to interact with, as well as an entirely new story to discover and a ton of sidequests to hunt down. If you're into open-ended RPGs, then this one should already be on your radar.

Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 is available right now for PC, PlayStation 5, and Xbox Series X|S. You can read our very own Ashley's review of the game right here.

Joe has been writing for TechRaptor for several years, and in those years has learned a lot about the gaming industry and its foibles. He’s originally an… More about Joseph
